website_summaries.verdict: A durable, reliable and very accurate red dot sight that is a great value at its rock-bottom price point.
pros: Bright reticle at night that makes dot easy to see
Choice of red or green dot color
Easy to set up and zero
cons: Set screws each use different sizes of Allen wrench, a hassle to switch up when adjusting sights

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tactical red dot sight
customer_reviews.text: I've been in the market for a tactical scope for my AR15 but didn't have a ton of money to spend on one and stumbled across this red dot. I am more than pleased with my purchased. The sight is excellent quality with multiple settings. There's more than one reticle ranging from dot to cross hairs, you can choose green or red as well as adjust the brightness. At night the reticle is nice and bright and during the day can still be seen. Customer service is absolutely amazing and even followed up with me a couple days after to check in. Would recommend this product and company any time.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Anthony

customer_reviews.title: First impressions were great. Looks sharp
customer_reviews.text: I figured I'd wait a couple months before reviewing the product. First impressions were great. Looks sharp, feels sturdy, bright reticles, and super crisp and open line of vision. I however put this on my Remington 870. It could not stand up to the task of 12 gauge. However I loved it when it worked. Definitely a nice rifle sight but would not recommend on a high caliber rifle or shotgun.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle A.

customer_reviews.title: Dainty garbage
customer_reviews.text: Literally broke in half on the first shot. If you geniuses at Dagger Defense are going to put "shotgun" in the item description, maybe you should test out the durability with some Mossberg 12ga recoil.
customer_reviews.author: Dickle

customer_reviews.title: Lifetime customer
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the sight on a Monday and got it Wednesday morning with a message saying that if there were any issues with anything, that it would be taken care of no questions asked. I've rarely had that caliber of customer service with any products I've purchased, let alone a $60 sight. I couldn't be happier with the product and the customer service that Dagger Defense provides. I will be a lifetime customer of Dagger Defense.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else. Trust me.
customer_reviews.text: Despite the negative reviews I thought I’d try one of these since they’re cheap. Never again. The sight reticle was terrible. I could see 3 of them all overlapping each other going off to the right side. I tried both included batteries, I tried a name brand battery, I left the sight on for over 10 mins, I even installed the battery in the opposite direction. NO CHANGE at all. I just went ahead and bought another Eotech and returned the Dagger Defense. Not mad, just disappointed. Maybe I got one from a bad batch, who knows but I’d look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great holo sight for the money. There are a lot of similar sights on the market which leads me to believe everyone buys the same product from china and puts their branding. Well with Dagger Defense you support a veteran business and you also get quality control so that is a plus. Easy to zero in and holds zero pretty well, adjusting it is easy. Make sure to loctite your mounting screws as you should anyway. My only gripe is one of reticle is blurry, it is the circular dot with crosshair. Theres too much going on with that reticle so I dont mind, I use the circular dot and plain cross they are crisp.
customer_reviews.author: Jaymus

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I was prepared to have low expectations for this sight given it's price when I bought it ($45) and I was pleasantly surprised. I mounted it to a KelTec KSG and so far it's been exactly on target. I have noticed the reticle can get a little blurry and out of focus depending on the angle I look at it. It's also a little hard to see when it's really bright outside even at the highest brightness level. Still, it's quite a lot of functionality and performance for the price. I would definitely buy it again and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a cheap optic for less precise work.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great budget friendly red/ green dot sight without compromising quality.
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price! I honestly thought it would be a cheap clone, but based on the reviews and the need for a basic red dot I decided to give it a try - only 40 bucks. I also did other research on line. This red/ green dot has quality construction, multiple cross-hair types, red/ green dot color, easy to zero, holds zero, clear glass, looks awesome and saved me money from a comparable brand name product. I would highly recommend to those shooters new/ experts who are looking for a reasonably priced red dot sight. I hope DD comes out with other quality sights/ scopes.
customer_reviews.author: Tank

customer_reviews.title: Dagger Defense DDHB red dot
customer_reviews.text: I received my sight within 2 days of ordering. I purchased it for my Mossberg 500. I do have astigmatism in my dominant shooting eye and found the image to be a bit blurry. This was overcome by adjusting where on the rail I secured the sight. I moved it a little towards the center of the rail vs at the stock end and it is clear and crisp as day. It is a solid, well made optic. However, I have not taken it to the range to zero/test fire it yet. I will edit my review after I test it.
customer_reviews.author: NoxX22

customer_reviews.title: Solid budget choice.
customer_reviews.text: *update 12/20/17 Battery with the red circle dot reticle lasted 10 weeks on the lowest setting. That's 1,680 hours. Not too bad for a budget unit. I've had this mounted to a 10.5" AR pistol for about 6 months. It's held zero through 700 rounds and zero attempt to "baby" it. I'm testing battery life right now. Fresh battery, red "circle dot" on lowest setting, been going 3 weeks now with no sign of stopping. Will update when the battery finally dies. Why 4 stars? The front glass is mirrored which makes being "low profile" hard.
customer_reviews.author: Ret.popo

customer_reviews.title: Thanks MIKE
customer_reviews.text: When i first purchased this and went to the range i immediately was let down 3 rounds and dot floated to the top right of sight. Was ready to return till a Representative name Mike from dagger explained about a sight lock on left side of sight.Using a small Allen wrench which was supplied i zeroed sight and turned lock screw with Allen wrench until slightly tight. DO NOT OVER TIGHTEN OR DOT WILL NOT ZERO IN AND STAY IN PLACE.Once done it holds zero with no problem. Nice clean crisp sight if dot gets blurry lower brightness or change batteries.Dagger has a great support staff.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be of pretty high quality
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be of pretty high quality, has held zero with the 100 or so rounds I've put through it, sighted in pretty easily in the indoor range i went to, however when i went to a longer outdoor range i couldn't see the reticle very well at all. The brightest setting made it so i could BAAAAARELY and i mean BARELY see it and it made it really hard to get and stay on target at only 50 yards. Red was maybe slightly easier to see than green which with the green I honestly couldn't see it at all most times. Unfortunately for me its simply not bright enough and I'm going to have replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased customer
customer_reviews.text: Was going to go with a higher end optic but I just wanted something for my 10/22 and Ar15 (low recoil) that was accurate, not cheap but not going to break the bank and wanted something more then just a red dot. Like everyone else I have read the good and the bad reviews and decided to give it a shot. I like that it has four settings both in red and green. Glass is nice and clear. Came with two battery’s. I’ve put about 500 rounds and so far this thing has held zero. Came Packed In a super nice plastic case, almost like a Plano case. Guys at Dagger Defense, good work. Very Happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Justin242

customer_reviews.title: Bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: I'm an old Combat Infantryman and have been shooting with iron sights for 50+ years. Of course I have used scopes for long shooting with large caliber weapons and have used to a limited degree the "red dot" scopes. As age has caught up to me I was finding it hard to acquire a good sight picture with my M-4 so I thought I would try a reflex. This DDHB is a new lease on life for this old man. It's light, easy to install and dial in and seems to be built very well. Target acquisition is effortless and this thing puts the bullet on the mark. Thanks Dagger Defense.
customer_reviews.author: SSG Rock 67-71

customer_reviews.title: Best Sight for the money!! Amazing product!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing looking sight! If the looks don’t get you to buy this sight then let me tell you about performance! So both red and green and all 8 different recticles are bey crisp!! And look amazing! This will cowitness perfectly with any A2 front post sight and mounts very easily and very securely to your rail! Don’t hesitate with this don’t stress over the price. I own several different Dagger defense items and I trust them with my life and if anything has to go to customer service than there CS is the best! If y’all have any questions message me! Everything comes with the sight packaged well with Allen wrenches instructions and all batteries to!
customer_reviews.author: JDaigle3279

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable, can't handle even moderate recoil
customer_reviews.text: Worked okay on a Ruger 10/22 but when I put it on an AR15 pistol shooting 300 blackout subsonics with a suppressor it doesn't seem to like the recoil as the reticles fade in and out. I tried new batteries twice and each time after 20-30 rounds the same thing happens. The single dot seems to work the best, but the other reticle choices fade in and out with the recoil, which isn't much. So I would recommend for .22lr and air guns only.
customer_reviews.author: Burt Gummer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, Holds Zero
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these - my first one was for my dedicated AR .22 build, second was purchased for my AR 7.5-inch .223 SBR. I used blue loctite on rail screws AND on W&E screws - this is important! Once I zeroed them in, I used the locking set screw. Both have held zero with no issues at all. Several hundred rounds later each. This is a great sight, and I love the company! Would definitely recommend this sight.
customer_reviews.author: Rmorton2112

customer_reviews.title: You'll get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Blurry out the box not matter the setting low to high Blurry. Didn't even have the chance to try it. Also the the red dot and the other shapes are not right, meaning not a complete red dot circle or cross. I'd change the battery to Duracell and nothing change. Disappointing Updated: I have tried to contact the seller with no result. So far bad customer service. save your money and but a Bushnell or Vortex, they have decent products and great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Jackoutofthebox

customer_reviews.title: Great sight-holds setting
customer_reviews.text: This replaced an ADC red dot that went into the gargabe. I mounted it on a Ruger Mark III Competition Target. Went to the range and fine tuned my red dot. I was able to get a 10 shot group down to 3/4" at 21' using a bench rest. You have a choice of four reticles in red or green. You have the ability to dial up the intensity of the dot. I have used this gun at the range 15+ times shooting approx. 200 rds each visit, and have not needed to adjust the red dot. Good product
customer_reviews.author: GJ Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Not the red dot for me
customer_reviews.text: Well I went through 3 of these scopes due to Halos, Ghosting, battery cover would not stay on. Dagger customer service was Great!, they sent me out replacement scopes but they ALL had issues while using indoors the reticle would ghost/starburst you could see etching of some sort inside on the glass not consistent with the reticle. If I need it in a self defense situation I want a crisp clear sight picture, it was not as noticeable outside in bright light. I have since looked through several other red dots to see if it was me or the scope and all I can say is there are better options out there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value, works great
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, works good, but a little finicky on battery install. The battery cover can be tightened to an almost infinite positions within a range, but it will affect the unit turning on/off. Just don't tighten it all the way without checking the function. Back it off a hair if it doesn't turn on and it will stay functioning. The cover will not back out due to an o-ring seal, and will stay tight wherever you leave it within the range. I have purchase three of them and figured out they all do the same thing. Easy to accommodate, once you figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did not work, returned.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t expecting much from a cheap optic... however this wasn’t functional at all. The “dot” was more of a blurry constellation in the sight. I changed batteries, but still couldn’t get it to work. I have perfect 20/20 vision, so it wasn’t a stigmatizim issue that they suggested in the accompanying paperwork if there were issues. Save your time, find something else.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: I’ll start by saying that comparing it to a $300+ rds is a little unfair considering this is 1/6th price. The dot blooms, the crosshairs layer and the glass has some distortion. But it works, is accurate and definitely lethal to 50 yards. The housing is robust and does not take up much of your field of view. Is this as good as a trigicon or a holosun? Absolutely not but for what it is and the price point it’s simply unbeatable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but not good either
customer_reviews.text: Seemed pretty good out of the box until I installed the battery. Gives off heavy flare from the reticle even with the light setting g on low. I understand this is a low end cheap one. Not and EoTec or Trij. But figured with reading the reviews wanted to give it a whirl. But I slapped it one put about 100 rounds through it. Didnt hold its zero. So I took it off and bought a Trij. Probably just hold on to it for a cheap build later down the road.
customer_reviews.author: Wyatt Earp

customer_reviews.title: Dagger Def. Halosight.
customer_reviews.text: Being a veteran owned company, I was surprised to see, “Made in China”. Disappointed. I mounted mine on a pellet pistol, American Classic with Steel Breech option, and optional Monstrom Rail. Being a pump pistol, there will be a lot of shock and awe applied to it. It felt really Well built when first handled. Now after some use the image has developed a Shadow on the lense. Unsatisfactory. I have since gone with a higher end, SigSauer Romeo5 Red dot sight.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbosocal

customer_reviews.title: Meh... Quality lacking
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this item is very lacking from my experience, even for the price. My first one, the plastic "lense" in front (the bluish piece in the picture) completely rattle out just by driving in my vehicle on a dirt road to the range, making it worthless. The customer service was great and they sent me a new one free of charge. However, the next one also looks kinda shady and isn't centered properly in the frame. It aligns fine, but the quality just looks poor and I'm afraid to use it for fear of the problem happening again. I'd definitely buy a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Complicated

customer_reviews.title: Terrific sight! This represents my 4th or 5th Dagger ...
customer_reviews.text: Terrific sight ! This represents my 4th or 5th Dagger Defense product and ALL have functioned perfectly. Great / solid construction able to take the punishment of my VEPR 12 / AR 15 / Mossberg 12 and AK 47. All told there have been a couple of thousand rounds fired with the DAGGER mounted with no sight readjustment required. Product just cannot be equaled even at a price 3 - 4 X the cost of the DAGGER. VERY HIGHLY RECOMMENDED !! Thanks DAGGER.
customer_reviews.author: Terry D

customer_reviews.title: Total piece of junk, I will be sending mine ...
customer_reviews.text: Total piece of junk, I will be sending mine back. Dot wasn't even within 3 feet of target at 50 yards after it was mounted. Finally got it somewhat close to the target with the dot reticle. Once I picked a different reticle it was off by about 8 inches and low. Should have bought a name brand.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Friday

customer_reviews.title: Very BRIGHT!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to but another red dot style optic after buying a Bushnell red dot that was well rated but was not bright enough to see in normal daylight. My primary concern with this light was that it would not be bright enough. It is very bright, and the red/green feature is nice. The multiple types of crosshair are cool too. This is super nice for the price point. I may buy another after I have more time to test it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really don't like that there are 2 "two" different size allen wrenches ...
customer_reviews.text: Works okay- when it works. After a minute or two it just cuts off and will not turn on a again for a few minutes. Also, the reticle is quite thick- even on the lowest setting, so distant targets are obscured. Also, I really don't like that there are 2 "two" different size allen wrenches needed for adjustment. Just a pain. If I could find the box, I would return it. Edit: I was able to contact the company and they sent a replacement that worked perfectly out of the box. Great customer service; will buy their products again
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: UUQ is a good buy
customer_reviews.text: UUQ has a cheap red laser you can remove ... pretty good overall ... the UUQ and Dagger Defense red/green reflex sights are identical ... from the same Chinese factory ... same box, same battery brand, everything but the name on the box but the UUQ has a peel off sticker, costs less and you get the laser to use or throw away ... you decide
customer_reviews.author: C. Finley

customer_reviews.title: Great budget optic.
customer_reviews.text: Great budget optic. After reading so many good reviews I had to try one of these optics. I have since bought many more because its such a fun optic with its red/green three reticles and multiple brightness. I had questions and found that the Dagger Defense customer service is top notch.
customer_reviews.author: JD Weaver

customer_reviews.title: I just got it like an hour ago and it's a mess
customer_reviews.text: I was really skeptical when buying this when looking at it and I should have gone with my gut feeling. I just got it like an hour ago and it's a mess. The only reticle that looks even remotely close to decent is the dot. Everything else shines on the inner small glass and you can see a lot of scratches on the little piece of glass. Not the main pieces of glass the small one near the back of the sight. Everything but the dot is a blurry (I tried multiple brand name batteries) mess along with scratches that reflect of the little piece of scratched glass.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The reticles are blurry with a shadow. I replace ...
customer_reviews.text: The reticles are blurry with a shadow. I replace the batteries that shipped with the product with fresh batteries as some reviews suggested. No change and still blurry with shadows. I initiated a return request but decided to test more in the range. It does not hold zero. I use a bore sighter to help get close to zero but the elevation adjustment does not work. It is probably broken since I cannot go the opposite direction. You get what you pay for with this item. I will try to contact the customer service if they can help me with the elevation adjustment screw.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pleased for the money. Good value.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been pleasantly surprised with this sight. I bought it for my son’s 10/22. It’s held zero after several outings now. The sight is clear and sharp. The elevation and windage adjustments don’t have a nice crisp click as you make adjustments; the clicks are mushy at best. Also, theirs no marking to indicate what a click means. 1/4 moa? 1/2 Moa? Who knows. Didn’t matter. We just kept shooting and adjusting until we got. Once we got it, it’s stayed zeroed. The kid likes the sight and enjoys shooting more with it. It’s like his video games, he says.
customer_reviews.author: CCT

customer_reviews.title: have had two of these items, and first of ...
customer_reviews.text: have had two of these items, and first of all the finish isn"t done very well. its a flat black paint , that can easyily be scratched when adjusting it or touching it. also on both of mine the windage adjustment doesn't work properly, ( difficult to get it to move). and now that I've tried to contact the company for a replacement, they are nowhere to be found. no contact any where and most of their web pages show up as non exsisting. my advice is, BEWARE1111
customer_reviews.author: Byron

customer_reviews.title: Spend the extra money for a bushnell
customer_reviews.text: Tried this on my ksg, used 1 time 1 year after I got it, rectical if to to the left and will not adjust, rear of sight also came loose and springs were not flush, re tightened but did not help, broken after 50 rounds, contacted dagger, sorry bro, 1 or 2 months out of the 1 year, kick rocks, terrible product and customer service
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Really good for the price
customer_reviews.text: It gives a great look to the gun seems to be quaility made, has everything needed really, different sight options to choose from, and different color options as well. I am overall happy with the product and shipping speed. It came in a padded box and two batteries. Would recommend this to anyone that doesnt need a big name sight this one works just As good. It has no movement in the reddot whereever you move your head it stays on target.. update.. I sighted it in yesterday and it works great,
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Same cheap import for 50% more.
customer_reviews.text: This sight is identical to a million other offerings for much less. Here's the one I bought for $25.  Check out the comparison photos. The sights are identical. The size, settings, material, the cheap batteries with Chinese packaging, and the box they came in (except for the image on the outside) are all identical. The only difference is the that this one has a screen print on the top, and it costs 50% more. It works fine, but save your money and buy the same thing from someone else for less.
customer_reviews.author: M. Night Shyam-alien

customer_reviews.title: Built good and was on target out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this sight for my smith and Wesson MP 15-22, at first I just wanted a cheap sight to put on it so I ordered this one because I like the variable sight pictures and the looks of the sight overall. When it arrived to my surprised the thing was built pretty good, doesn't feel flimsy or easy to break. I mounted it onto my rifle and took it out to the range for some shooting and to my surprise the thing was dead on right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Appears to be same as UUQ combo scope.
customer_reviews.text: This appears to be the same red dot that comes with the UUQ C4-16X50EG+HD103B Rifle Scope. Nearly identical except for the side mount laser does not come with the Dagger Defense model. I was somewhat disappointed as I thiught this would be a higher quality item than my previous red dot combo. As for function...it works pretty well for the $.
customer_reviews.author: LBHunter3

customer_reviews.title: Better Shrouded than Others in this Class
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice sight for the price. The primary reason I chose this one over the many other red dot sights hovering near this price range is that I shoot in very sunny weather, and wanted a less open design that would help shroud the display. This sight did not disappoint, with the dot still visible in broad daylight. The dot is bright and fairly small for a sight in this price range--a major plus when trying to hit that small bull's-eye. Others have commented that batteries don't last long, but they are cheap enough on Amazon and I have not had to replace them yet.
customer_reviews.author: Book Gnome

customer_reviews.title: Works, but is fuzzy.
customer_reviews.text: The reticle on this is rather fuzzy. It depends on your application whether this affects you. Airsoft guns would work great with it. My 10/22 shoots better than this sight. This led to problems sighting it in. It probably has an 8-10 moa dot on it, which means that if you simply want a sight for shooting at rather large targets at 50 or less yards, it would probably be great. I was trying to hit three-inch targets at 50 yards and had a hard time. Silhouette shooting, this would be great. Ended up on my pellet rifle that isn't very accurate, so it all worked out.
customer_reviews.author: Dawson dude

customer_reviews.title: Honest review
customer_reviews.text: I’m going to give it to you straight...is this top of the line? No. Will it survive being dropped, whacked, elbowed, etc...? No. What this is; is a budget red dot that will hold zero, when firing 5.56/2.23, without a sweat. It has a good reticle. It gets good battery life. It is great for plinking, quick target acquisition in a home defense situation, and for short range targets. You would be hard pressed to find a better red dot for 40 bucks!
customer_reviews.author: John W

customer_reviews.title: Zeroed at 300 meters and it holds it very well.
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe you can't get a reflex site that holds a zero this well and looks this great for such a low price. I was looking to buy and EOTech, but my wallet couldn't handle that after the rifle purchase so I grabbed one of these while saving for the EOTech. After using it for a couple of months, I don't think i'll be buying that EOTech after all.
customer_reviews.author: Book_Guru

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Wow what a great product at a great price! Best sight I've gotten for under 50 bucks. Looks great on my new shotgun too. Edit 5/9/20 Finally got to go out and try this sight. It is impossible to see in the daylight (3pm). Had to swap to the pop up sights. Completely useless during the day tho. Even swapped out batteries with a better working sight.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Great scope for the money
customer_reviews.text: Optical quality and features are as good as the $500 red dot reflex scopes. I question whether scope will be as tough as the more expensive scopes in the long run, however. Having fired 300 rounds through an AR-15 I am glad I didn't spend too much on this scope as I now wish I had some magnification included into the scope's features. At 100 yards the dot covers the entire target greatly affecting accuracy. I guess I will probably end up spending the big bucks on this type of scope now.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn B.

customer_reviews.title: Waited 3 weeks- bad out of the box.  Made in China.
customer_reviews.text: Ugh. 3 mirrored images of the crosshairs with a circle. This is the third cheap red/green dot with similar issues. I have contacted DD directly and am waiting for a response. This might be the last holo sight I buy from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Good reflex sight
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this sight with the intentions of putting it on a Ruger Mark IV Lite. Big mistake as it is 10oz and just didn't work out. That was on me being new to these sights. I since gave it to a friend with a Ruger 10/22 Takedown and he has loved it. Two colors and 4 sight options is hard to beat for $40. Really wish this company had a micro red dot for pistols. I would have ordered that one.
customer_reviews.author: HoumaGuy

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for the Money
customer_reviews.text: Have not received the last one ordered yet. But, this is the 4th one I have ordered in a couple months. Love this sight, adjusts spot on and holds zero even after removal from gun twice. I have own several different brands and like this sight best of all. For me these have been great sights and I believe it is the best available in its price range. It has received numerous high reviews online. Would highly recommend. As for Dagger Defense, you could not ask for a more customer orientated and friendly company to do business with. Am sure I will be doing more business again with this company in the future.
customer_reviews.author: malcolm1999

customer_reviews.title: By all accounts This is one of the best bang for the buck reflex sites on the market
customer_reviews.text: By all accounts This is one of the best bang for the buck reflex sites on the market. Seems well built, attractive aesthetically and well packaged. However the site will not mount flush and level on my DPMS Panther rail. I also tried to mount it on my aftermarket picatinny rail handgaurds and again it will not mount straight and flush. Flush, secure mounting is pretty important for a dot reflex sight. I will have to return the sight and put off zeroing my gun this weekend.
customer_reviews.author: EDGYVETTE LLC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Sight! Awesome Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding company! I had a problem with the sight sitting straight on my rail. The base wasn't properly aligned with the sight. I sent a email off to Dagger Defense and got a reply the same afternoon from Mike. He said he was going to ship me a replacement the next morning. The new one lined up perfectly. Easy to zero, looks great, seems well built. That is five star customer service!
customer_reviews.author: auggie

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, if it's darker out.
customer_reviews.text: Fairly sturdy construction. Tools were included. With fresh batteries, this sight does not work in outdoor conditions. Even with filtered, slightly cloudy conditions, it is not bright enough. Probably works fine from a covered, outdoor location. Buy if you shoot from dimly lit or shaded locations.
customer_reviews.author: Six7One

customer_reviews.title: Great Optic
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this optic for use on an AR pistol, an AR carbine, AK47, KSG, RDB and RFB and had one on my old mossberg 590 (5.56 mm, 7.62×39 mm, .308 and 12GA). It has held up to 2 moves across the country and being banged up when my wife knocked a couple of the rifles off the table at the range. This optic has held zero, adjusts easily and has a great variety of reticles and brightness levels for any lighting conditions. I have had no issues with the DDHB on any of my firearms and highly recommended it to anyone looking for a budget friendly, quality close quarters optic.
customer_reviews.author: Army11A

customer_reviews.title: Great service had a minor issue with the first one ...
customer_reviews.text: Great service had a minor issue with the first one problem rectified immediately definitely would recommend. mounted on my Smith & Wesson M&P AR15 sport2 perfectly right out of the box cowitness with my iron sights with very little adjustment very happy. Just keep in mind people this is a reflex sight under $100 for close-quarter combat hitting humans Center mass up to a hundred yards not a competition shooting Styles sight get a scope if you want to shoot the balls off a bird further out with that said definitely would purchase another
customer_reviews.author: Liarhater

customer_reviews.title: I'd gladly pay more
customer_reviews.text: Got this sight for $49 and it's honestly better than alot of the $100 sights. I got it for my scorpion with the intention to replace it with a nicer one later but after about 700 rounds through and it staying dead on I think I'll keep it till it breaks. Liked it so much I bought my dad one for Christmas and he loves his as well. 5***** all day. I got mine in early December of 2019 and will update regularly
customer_reviews.author: chase

customer_reviews.title: Quality control?
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this red dot sight. Came in a padded case, two batteries, and an Allen wrench for mounting and adjustments. That's about as far as I got. One of the mounting screws was cross-threaded. It was a struggle to loosen and I couldn't get it to thread again. I'm concerned that trying to make it work will only result in me having to pull out the extractor bits. 🤷🏼‍♂️
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money on this poorly manufactured product.
customer_reviews.text: This poorly made sight is very very cheaply made. It is Made in China. You can see in the images where glue around the glass lens element is uneven and missing in some parts. Battery cover was not clean and smooth when removing which was surprising. Don’t waste your money on this cheap poor quality sight, you‘ll be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy M.

customer_reviews.title: First one was defective, second one was just as crappy.
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, I really like the optic but the first one I got the light somehow moved and there was no way of ever getting my gun zeroed. They sent me a replacement but I haven't really put it through its rounds yet. Got the replacement, sighted it all in. Went to use it again. Again, light has moved off center and again, useless. I've had cheap daisy sights that have held up better than this one sitting on a rack. Very disappointed, now I have to get yet, another one, and sight it in all over again.
customer_reviews.author: Spawn

customer_reviews.title: Get this!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just finished zeroing out this red that I have a mounted on my centry alarm C93V2. I have to say I am super impressed on how great this red dot looks and functions . I own a Romeo 7 red dot that I payed $270 and I got to say that I enjoy shooting with this red dot for more than I do with the more expensive one hundred percent recommend you getting it if you’re looking for a red dot I don’t shoe in a war zone so I have no idea how good it will be in those circumstances however shooting at the range indoor outdoor I think you will be more than please
customer_reviews.author: Amir Tehrani

customer_reviews.title: Far exceeded my expectations!!
customer_reviews.text: This wonderful Red Dot system is robust and a breeze to mount and zero on your AR-15 or similar type rifles with the proper mounting rail. I was at the range when I removed my scope and mounted the DDHB to zero and was done in under 15 minutes. The various brightness adjustments as well as a choice between RED or GREEN is also a big plus depending on your targets colors. After three rounds I was zeroed in and started the durability test with another 100+ rounds. The ZERO never wavered and the "sight" was very clear and easy to get "On Target". I highly recommend this wonderful and inexpensive Red/Green Dot.
customer_reviews.author: George S.

customer_reviews.title: A bit blurry and a bit off axis
customer_reviews.text: I have to keep it on just the dot as all other reticle styles are blurry most of the time. The red dot surely is as well but it's at least not as distracting. The reticles with horizontal/vertical lines are off axis a bit. Should be okay on the rifle I have it on but I wouldn't say I'm impressed with it as some people seem to be.
customer_reviews.author: Kasey

customer_reviews.title: I like this!
customer_reviews.text: First time trying a reticle. First time owning a AR style pistol with picatinny rail. I'll recommend the adjustable tension screwdriver so you don't overtighten or not tighten enough the optic housing to your rail. Too loose/tight could cause it to shoot left or right because it's not on straight. Four reticle sights, NICE!. Two colors in one optic? I'm more than happy. AND it's made by veterans. They included a sticker and I slapped that baby right on my pistol case. setting the height of the reticle to my personal view was easy with the included instructions and hex wrench.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Berg

customer_reviews.title: The only viable, quality optic for -2× the $!
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality for the price. Great reticles, easily manipuated in the dark, and very accurate. The 1/4 moa "clicks" while sighting are very faint, sometimes only noticable in one of the two directions of the adjustment "turret" screw, but once it's in, it's golden. Would buy again. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: I really like that! Powers up and down with turns of ...
customer_reviews.text: I see a slight doubling of the reticule at all intensity levels. Have no idea if this is normal or not. Have not yet fired the firearm (under construction; parts coming in the mail) with this sight in place. We shall see. Small; lightweight. Big hex-screws for sight adjustments; I really like that! Powers up and down with turns of knob on side. That's nice; no switches that can fail. Four reticules; easily choose which by moving switch at rear to one side or the other. Easy. Delivered for about $51-- several bucks less than for which I saw a similar model at retail price at Scheels in Sparks, NV.
customer_reviews.author: Leadfoot

customer_reviews.title: It easily mounted on to my 300 Blackout
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sight after a lot of time reading reviews and comparing specs with other optics in it’s class. When I first pulled it out of the box I was impressed by the look, and it felt well constructed in my hand. It easily mounted on to my 300 Blackout. First day at the range with it while I attempted to sight it in the dot moves to the bottom right corner of the lens after the first trigger pull. Tried turning on/off, batteries in/out, adjusting etc. Nothing worked
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for what you get...
customer_reviews.text: Over all this is a good product. It is a 4 MOA from what I can tell. I wouldn’t recommend this for an AR-15 or anything for that matter if you plan on shooting farther than 75 yards. It holds a zero well and is crisp when outside looking into the sight. Indoors it is not the case. It’s washed out and blurry. All in all this is a great little sight for 22lr and anything you’re not shooting long range.
customer_reviews.author: marion culp

customer_reviews.title: Better than most high priced sights!
customer_reviews.text: This sight was almost zeroed out of the box. Six rounds and I was on target. Remember to lock in your zero with the small allen wrench sent to avoid embarrassment. Once I attained zero the second time I tightened the proper bolt to lock in zero and have been perfect over the next 300 rounds. Very happy with this sight.
customer_reviews.author: Shari R.

customer_reviews.title: No Green! Red only!
customer_reviews.text: If your looking for a red AND green dot sight-this is NOT it! Straight out of the box no green sight. Even though it is clearly labeled for both colors. Fortunately I only use red. Clear crisp and easy to mount and adjust. But " you get what you pay for " definitely applies here! Made in China so no surprise.
customer_reviews.author: Kerrie Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Arrives in nice packaging, and worked the moment the battery (two ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I have to say that when I first discovered this product, I was skeptical. However, I figured I would roll the dice and see. I’m new to ARs and let me tell you - this product is a winner. Arrives in nice packaging, and worked the moment the battery (two included) was input. The product is solid and doesn’t feel “chintzy” in any way. It’s as described and solid - and even more solid value. I wouldn’t hesitate to purchase another one of these, and will recommend the product to friends. Can’t wait to utilize this at the range!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan C.

customer_reviews.title: Not for sunlight, low light only.
customer_reviews.text: Great sight for indoor or low light situations but absolutely worthless in daylight. With variable dial turned up to maximum, I am unable to see any sight pattern until I pan towards a lower light area. Changed the battery and still unable to see the sights in sunlight but it appears when in the shadows.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID PETERS

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to sight in and still getting large (6-7 inch) ...
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to sight in and still getting large (6-7 inch) groups at 50-60 yards. Plan on using for up-close drive hunting in the brush so it should be ok, but if you want something with greater accuracy than I've described, I'd spend more and try something else. Update - after a lot of rounds, still not satisfied with grouping. Sucked it up and bought an EOTECH - the difference is amazing. From the same rifle I get 1" groups with the EO, 6-7" with this sight.
customer_reviews.author: Shane B

customer_reviews.title: DAGGER DEFENsE DDH-B nothing with scope does not work properly
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this item Scope only no owners manual battery no lens cleaner ,bought battery to find does not work as should only cross hair works all other setting not working.SELLER WOULD NOT ANSWER ANY QUESTIONS BUY THE PINEY HALF THE PRICE BETTER SERVICE IT IS THE SAME RED DOT.
customer_reviews.author: David Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Buy it !!!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, good quality, excellent for the price! Can’t beat it! Will definitely buy again and tell friends! Glass is clear and the Dot and others are also clear not blurry. Easy to zero. Mount is very solid and well made. Outstanding customer service. I had a question and the were all over it. Yes they’re made in China but it’s an American company if it’s not right they’ll fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Heiney13

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price! Don't get crazy...
customer_reviews.text: I really like it for the price! Does exactly what I wanted on my plinker AR-15. I wouldn't use it for combat, but it's great for what it is. Use some common sense and don't compare it to a product 10-15 times the price and you should be quite happy. Great company to buy from as well! DD always punches above it's weight class in my opinion!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Reed

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This red dot is very well built can mount it anywhere on the rail. Came with extra battery. Looks great on my AR. I am very impressed with the quality. Hope it holds up! Will leave another review if it doesnt hold zero but I believe this is my new go to red dot. Also has other sights circle, bullseye, cross.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Herbert

customer_reviews.title: Ok for $30ish
customer_reviews.text: This is really only usable at the lowest power setting. Any brightness setting above the lowest and there is a TON of reflection of the interior walls of the sight. just a blur of green or red reflection from every angle. $40 is pushing it with this thing. Usable but do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CPTSIG

customer_reviews.title: Airsoft use ONLY
customer_reviews.text: This product does not transition between the reticles and maintain accuracy. If you were to zero using the red dot only and then switch to the 65moa circle you would likely not be able to effectively engage your target. This (in my opinion) makes this a dangerous sight to mount on a legitimate firearm. Would be outstanding for airsoft rifles.
customer_reviews.author: TR

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I tried some more expensive sights, but they just could not be seen in daylight. This sight can be seen on the brightest day and can be adjusted lower for low light use. I really like the multiple sight pictures you can choose from. It feels very solid and well built. It was very easy to zero and the adjustments were very positive. I have only shot at targets so far, but I look forward to some hog hunting soon. You will not be un-happy with this sight. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: W. Cannon

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Attached easily and quickly. Sighting in was easy and straightforward. Reticle image is clear and bright. I can't believe the quality of this sight at this price. I read the reviews and thought I could have problems, and it might be a hassle to exchange, but that wasn't the case. My experience with the company tells me if I had a problem, they'd make it right.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Aramini

customer_reviews.title: This would be a good consideration for an entry level red dot sight
customer_reviews.text: This would be a good consideration for an entry level red dot sight. There are four different reticles available in both green and red. The rotary knob is a rheostat that allows you to continually adjust the intensity. It seems to be common at this level that changing reticles requires re-zeroing. You should consider picking one and staying with it. Make sure the w/e lockscrew is loose before making adjustments and remember to tighten it after. Once zeroed, I was able to hold a respectable group at 50 yds. At a fraction of the cost of the high-end sights, it did its job quite well, which makes it a pretty decent value.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B.

customer_reviews.title: but don't expect a lightweight plastic unit best suited for airsoft
customer_reviews.text: It works exactly as advertised. It's got some weight to it, lending to the belief it would withstand some abuse. However, it does effect the balance of the rifle. Nothing too concerning, but don't expect a lightweight plastic unit best suited for airsoft; this is best suited for the real thing. It works wonderfully on my Beretta CX4 Storm.
customer_reviews.author: D. EllisTop Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a very reasonable price!!
customer_reviews.text: Very fast delivery. Great buy for the money. I had a slight issue with the red dot sight just one reticle was a bit fuzzy. Dager Defense responded extremely quickly to my email and replaced the unit with a new one without and trouble. Customer service is one of the best I've seen from an Amazon retailer! Great Product and great company with outstanding customer service. I really love the way the sight looks and functions on my riffle. Order one you will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Schmoops

customer_reviews.title: Love this sight!  You can’t find a better deal!
customer_reviews.text: This sight is perfect for the cost. It’s easy to mount and operate. The 4 reticle with red and green options make it fun to use. It’s also easy to use weather you use one eye or both eyes to aim. My only complaint is having to lock and unlock the screw each time you want to adjust it. It makes for sighting in to be a lengthy process... but to find something of this quality at $40, it’s not something that would cause me to knock this down to 4 stars. I have even received lots of complements on how it looks on the gun. 5 Stars all day for this sight!!
customer_reviews.author: Sam P.

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold zero -Well it is actually broken.
customer_reviews.text: Updated on 9/1/2018, I finally went to the range and tried to re-zero this. Nope! the dot/circle is stuck on the lower right corner. no adjustment can move it out of the corner. It is less than 1 year old and used two times. Do not buy. It lost zero after 75 shot gun shots. It is a toy. Not for home defense and anything that you life depends on it. Get something better.
customer_reviews.author: Trader John

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for under $50!
customer_reviews.text: This item is okay for the price that one pays for it. Absolutely no parallax correction, but that is understandable for this value of product. The dot is really bright, the optic is sharp and it mounts really well to my firearm. I have not been able to get it to co-witness my sights on some of my firearms; but on a standard AR it seems to work well with a front sight co-witness. Overall, not a bad red-dot sight for under $50!
customer_reviews.author: SWG - Columbus, Ohio

customer_reviews.title: Its a great  sight.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I haven't used it at all. As the sight arrived and I hit hard times so the rifle i had to sell. However that doesn't mean I haven't tested it. Battery life reasonable Reflex image all settings clear and detailed Strength the clear part is glass I bet it will crack given a hard enough hit the metal of the outside is quality.
customer_reviews.author: Logan Dellecese

customer_reviews.title: Not the best customer service
customer_reviews.text: This thing was the hardest to zero out. Some of the dials just keep turning and turning while doing absolutely nothing. I wrote the buyer about my issues and was basically told to buy another one. I'm not just giving 1 star for the sight. Im giving it based on the ease of use of the unit, the customer service I received and the quality of the product. I will most certainly change my review if I can get one that works properly.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended, Awesome sight
customer_reviews.text: I received the sight on Thursday and mounted it to my 5.56 AR-15 that day. It was well packaged to ensure safety and came with the tools needed to mount and adjust the sight. I took it to the range with a friend who is a retired state trooper. With 4 clicks to adjust the sight, we were both pleased at how well the dot looked and how easily it was dialed in. Great product especially for the price. I also received an email a day after purchase to introduce me to the company and how they handle any issues that should arise. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Shelley Colpo

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sight
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect scope for a decent gun. I put it on my hi point 995ts and i barely had to adjust it. I was hitting a gong from 200 feet easily. It’s designed beautifully and works like a charm; Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: kevin pavey

customer_reviews.title: Great sight!
customer_reviews.text: Great sight at a good price! After installing the sight, i zeroed it off my iron sights and then went shooting. It was dead on! The pictures people upload of the reticle don’t do it justice, they camera can’t capture how it actually looks. Very clear and bright. This is my first reflex sight and I’m in love with it.
customer_reviews.author: Noble P.

customer_reviews.title: Wanted it to work... but didn’t...
customer_reviews.text: Looked good! First sight came up blurry put my glasses on and it was fixed.. I don’t have a high rx so never needed them nbd.. zeroed it with a bore sight took it to the range.. sight looked great loved that part but didn’t hold zero.. even locked the bolt they said to.. it was all over even at 25 yards hitting a full plate target.. I tried the cheaper option jus didn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for rifles, but might sit too high for shotguns.
customer_reviews.text: I went with this product based on a 1-star review that was later upgraded to 5-star due to the user’s experience with their customer service department. This is a quality product at a very good price. Excellent visibility and target acquisition. Very bright reticle. No issues with focus. Great for rifles but might ride a bit high for shotgun use.
customer_reviews.author: firewall g

customer_reviews.title: Had bad luck with this red dot
customer_reviews.text: First one arrived with a big scratch across the lens. Contacted seller/Amazon and Amazon shipped a new one out the next day. Second one arrived with a blurry reticule and a double image. So per instructions I took out The battery it shipped with and ordered new lithium batteries. Installed new battery and most the blurry disappeared but the reticule was still doubled up with one dot half overlapping with another. Will send this back with a refund request and order something else
customer_reviews.author: Brett A

customer_reviews.title: Without reservation I can say it is THE BEST sight for the money
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had found this sight months ago! Without reservation I can say it is THE BEST sight for the money. Great fast zeroing and bright easy to see selective reticles. It is built like a tank out of solid aluminum. Now, that being said I'm using it on an HK MP5 in .22 caliber so recoil is virtually non-existent. I'm not sure how this would hold up on a high-powered weapon. However I am going to mount it on my 9mm MP5 and give it a go. I wouldn't recommend this for an excursion in Helmand Province but for domestic Zombie hunting I give it a solid five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Hiram A

customer_reviews.title: Had some issues initially until I realized I really didn't
customer_reviews.text: When the reticle is much brighter than the environment (i.e max settings in a poorly lighted room) it indeed looks blurry. But outside, where it's relatively bright, I never had an issue, the reticle is super crisp. Which lead me to believe it has something to do with my eyes rather than the sights. In any case, I'm fully satisfied with it
customer_reviews.author: katya

customer_reviews.title: Great budget optic
customer_reviews.text: Comes packaged in a nice plastic case. Comes with everything needed to operate and install the optic. Ive put about 100 rounds through my ar9 with it installed with no issues. I didnt experience what some people say about the reticles being blurry or fuzzy. The brightness adjustments are smooth and precise. Accuracy was good and almost perfect out of the box. I'll have to see how it performs after 1000 rounds but so far I'm pretty happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Logan B.

customer_reviews.title: Defective out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this in December of 2016 and did not get a chance to use it until June 2017. When I went to the range for the first time, the green dot wouldn't come on, and the red dot would come on, but wouldn't change the brightness level. So I replaced the battery with no luck. Then I went ahead and shot it with the red, but then it would kick off after a few shots. I have another one of these and it's amazing, but the second one really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent site for the money
customer_reviews.text: Mounted on Daniels Defense M4v11lw AR. Dialed in at 25 yds, then proceeded to test and dialed in at 75 yds, getting dead center by 4th shot. The red dot is very clear, as are the other reticle options. I am co-witnessing with front iron site. Easy to line up, my AR has surgical accuracy and am very impressed with the quality of this site for the money.
customer_reviews.author: AJames

customer_reviews.title: Worthless crap!
customer_reviews.text: Piece of crap! Bought for my AR pistol thinking it would be ok for a cheap 50 to 100 yard sight. After about 30 rounds the lens and bezel fell out of the sight rendering it completely useless. It looks like it was held in with 3 drops of super glue. If you're looking for a close range optic save your money and put towards a quality sight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer
